str2: The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
Freedom, liberty, especially: a state of freedom from slavery. From eleutheros; freedom.
Anointed One; the Messiah, the Christ. From chrio; Anointed One, i.e. The Messiah, an epithet of Jesus.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: To free, set free, liberate. From eleutheros; to liberate, i.e. to exempt.

parse: Verb - Present Imperative Active - 2nd Person Plural
str2: To stand fast, stand firm, persevere. From the perfect tense of histemi; to be stationary, i.e. to persevere.
Therefore, then. Apparently a primary word; certainly, or accordingly.
Not, lest. A primary particle of qualified negation; not, lest; also (whereas ou expects an affirmative one) whether.

parse: Verb - Present Imperative Middle or Passive - 2nd Person Plural
str2: From en and echo; to hold in or upon, i.e. Ensnare; by implication, to keep a grudge.
Probably from the same as pale; anew, i.e. back, once more, or furthermore or on the other hand.
From the root of zeugnumi; a coupling, i.e. servitude; also the beam of the balance.
